page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block includes the suburbs of Patchway,Little Stoke and Stoke Gifford in the parishes of Patchway and Stoke Gifford on the northern fringe of Bristol. Little Stoke and Patchway were largely built between 1930 and the 1950's to house workers in Rolls Royce and nearby British Aerospace. These suburbs border the green belt of north Bristol which has remained unchanged farmland until recently. House building is now taking place and the population has risen rapidly since the 1971 census-Stoke Gifford 7,324 (+22%) Patchway 11,500 (+8%). Partly because of its position near the M4/M5 interchange, a major development plan has been produced for the area which includes extensive housing, high tech. industry and new roads which will transform the area.
